### 📌 Disease:
📌  Cassava Bacterial Blight

### 💥 Cause:
- 💥  Bacteria Xanthomonas axonopodis pv. manihotis. Spreads through water, contaminated tools, and infected plant parts.


### 😷 Symptoms:
- 😷  Brown blotches on leaves, water-soaked lesions on stems, yellowing, and dieback of stems and roots.


### 💊 Treatment & Prevention:
- 💊  Use disease-resistant cassava varieties, practice crop rotation, avoid overwatering, and attack early with antibiotics like streptomycin or copper-based fungicides when signs appear. Keep tools sterile to avoid spread.
